meanings.definition: A person who takes goods or property by force or through illegal means.
meanings.sent1: The spoliators broke into the house and stole valuable items.
meanings.sent2: The spoliators were caught red-handed stealing from the store.
meanings.sent3: The spoliators tried to take the cookies from the jar, but got caught by their mom.
meanings.sent4: The spoliators of peace disrupted the harmony of the neighborhood.
meanings.sent5: The spoliators in the story were depicted as greedy villains.
